* A&B Hawaii Inc., a subsidiary of Alexander & Baldwin Inc., Honolulu, an ocean transportation company, closed the purchases last week of four commercial properties for a total of almost $55.9 million.
* ADT Ltd., Hamilton, Bermuda, a security company, said Laidlaw Inc. had raised its stake in ADT to 28.8 percent, or 284.6 million common shares, from 27.7 percent previously.

* Avalon Corp., New York, a developer of oil and gas reserves, said it had sold 70 percent of its U.S. oil and natural gas assets to J.N. Exploration and Production L.P., Billings, Mont., for $13.6 million plus future payments contingent on the cash flow generated by the properties.

* Cincinnati Bell Inc., Cincinnati, a holding company, said its marketing services subsidiary, Matrixx Marketing Inc., had acquired majority ownership of two telemarketing agencies in Paris for about $39 million.

* Ivax Corp., Miami, Fla., a pharmaceutical company, said it would acquire all of the outstanding shares of Harris Pharmaceuticals Ltd., of London and Waterford, Ireland, a manufacturer and marketer of generic pharmaceutical products, in exchange for 6,250,000 shares of its common stock.
* Lone Star Technologies Inc., Dallas, a holding company, said its Lone Star Steel Company had filed a reorganization plan in the U.S. Bankruptcy Court.
* Meredith Corp., Des Moines, a publishing company, said its directors had authorized the repurchase of one million of its 18.5 million shares outstanding.

* Pool Energy Services Co., Houston, an oil field equipment rental company, said it had entered into a non-binding agreement in principle to sell its oil tools operations to a foreign company controlled by investors in Malaysia and Indonesia, for about $24.5 million.
* S. E. Nichols Inc., New York, an operator of discount stores in the Northeast, said it had filed for Chapter 11 protection in Federal Bankruptcy Court in Manhattan.

* Tyco Laboratories, Exeter, N.H., a fire-protection company, said it had completed the previously announced acquisition of all the operating assets of Wormald International Ltd., Australia, in a transaction valued in excess of $600 million.
